tool.name: Add_Shape_Attributes_Tool

param.name: inFeatClass
param.dialogReference: This is a feature class delineates the bathymetric high or low features.

param.name: Attributes
param.dialogReference:
The shape attributes to be generated.

  • ALL: all the shape attributes below

  • Compactness: the compactness attribute

  • Sinuosity,LengthWidthRatio: the sinuosity and length to width ratio attributes

  • Circularity,Convexity,Solidity: the circularity, convexity and solidity attributes

param.name: tempFolder
param.dialogReference: This is temporary folder holding some temporal files/data.

param.name: headFeatClass
param.dialogReference: This is feature class identifies the head point of each bathymetric low feature or the start point of each bathymetric high feature, along the long axis.

param.name: footFeatClass
param.dialogReference: This is feature class identifies the foot point of each bathymetric low feature or the end point of each bathymetric high feature, along the long axis.

tool.summary:
This tool add a number of shape attributes to the input feature class. The following attributes are calculated to describe the polygon shape of each bathymetric high or low feature.

1. Compactness: Describe how compact the feature polygon is. More complex polygon shape has a lower compactness. It is calculated as 4*PI*A/P/P, where A is the area of the polygon, P is the perimeter of the polygon.

2. Sinuosity: Describe the sinuosity of the feature polygon. Larger the value more sinuous the feature polygon is. It is calculated as sinuous_length/head_foot_length.

3. LenghWidthRatio: Describe the length to width ratio of the feature polygon. Larger the value more elongate the feature polygon is. It is calculated as sinuous_length/mean_width.

4. Circularity: Describe how close the feature polygon is to a circle. Larger the value closer to a circle the feature polygon is. It is calculated as 4*PI/A/Pc/Pc, where Pc is the perimeter of the convex hull polygon that bounds the feature polygon.

5. Convexity: Describe the convexity of the feature polygon. More complex polygon has a lower convexity. It is calculated as Pc/P.

6. Solidity: Describe the solidity of the feature polygon. More complex polygon has a lower solidity. It is calculated as A/Ac.

In addition, a number of intermediate attributes are also calculated.

1. rectangle_Length: the length of the bounding rectangle (by width) that bounds the feature polygon

2. rectangle_Width: the width of the bounding rectangle (by width) that bounds the feature polygon

3. rectangle_Orientation: the orientation of the bounding rectangle (by width) that bounds the feature polygon

4. head_foot_length: the euclidean distance between the head (or start) and foot (or end) points of the feature polygon, along the long axis

5. sinuous_length: the sinuous distance between the head (or start) and foot (or end) points of the feature polygon, along the long axis

6. mean_width: the mean width of the feature polygon, calculated from a number of cross-sections perpendicular to the long axis of the feature polygon

searchKeys.keyword: This tool geneates shape attributes for each bathymetric high or low feature.
